definition.text: Correction; punishment; pain inflicted for punishment and correction, either by stripes or otherwise.Shall I so much dishonour my fair stars, On equal terms to give him chastisement I have borne chastisement I will not offend any more. Job 3 4:3 1.The chastisement of our peace, in Scripture, was the pain which Christ suffered to purchase our peace and reconciliation to God. Isaiah 5 3:5.
